general: This law makes changes to how marriages are registered, allows people who aren't the opposite gender to have a "civil partnership" which used to only be available to gay/lesbian couples, looks into why some babies die before they are born or soon after birth, and investigates when babies do not survive being born.

summary: The Civil Partnerships, Marriages and Deaths (Registration etc) Act 2019 is a law that makes important changes to how marriages and civil partnerships work in England and Wales. This includes allowing couples who aren't the same gender to have a civil partnership, making it easier for people to correct mistakes on their marriage or civil partnership documents, and introducing fines for those who don't follow the rules. These changes will affect anyone living in or outside the UK, no matter where they are in the world. So whether you're a couple getting married or entering into a civil partnership, or just need to fix a mistake on your documents, this law is here to help make things easier and more fair for everyone.
single:
* The Civil Partnerships, Marriages, and Deaths (Registration etc) Act 2019 aims to simplify the registration of marriages, civil partnerships, and deaths in England and Wales.
* The bill provides for the extension of civil partnerships to couples not of the same sex, allowing them to form a civil partnership in England and Wales.
* The bill also includes provisions for the registration of pregnancy loss and still-births, and coroners' investigations into still-births.
* The bill amends the Marriage Act 1949, the Civil Partnership Act 2004, and the Births and Deaths Registration Act 1953 to make changes to the registration of marriages, civil partnerships, and deaths.
* The bill provides for the Secretary of State to make regulations to implement the changes, and for the Lord Chancellor to make regulations in relation to coroners' investigations.
* The bill extends to England and Wales, and comes into force at the end of the period of two months beginning with the day on which it is passed.
